pros: Great place to work and advance your academic career. The collegiate atmosphere and focus on students make JU a top institution in the Southeast for students from across the country and around the world.
cons: Salaries may be lower than larger universities and institutions.

pros: Beautiful campus; nice facilities & grounds
cons: JU administration has been notified multiple times of a hostile work environment over many years and has continued to turn a blind eye & allow the bullying administrators to continue. This impacts faculty and student experience. JU has a real culture problem that needs to be addressed immediately before more faculty and/or students are harmed (google JU New York post for specific data on how bad the culture is). Salaries are low and faculty age treated as expendable resources.

pros: Tuition benefits are excellent and worth the lower wage.
cons: Low wages and difficulty in advancing into a different position.

review_title: High Tuition For Students. Low Pay For Employees.
job_title: Campus Security Officer in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Beautiful campus. Benefits: free tuition, Health, dental, 403B matching.
cons: They don't care about paying liveable wages. Be prepared to be micromanaged. There's a memeber of management that has worked there for decades who enjoys gas lighting and has gotten away with it, undetected and untouchable.

pros: Clear departmental communication, easy to navigate campus (beautiful too!)
cons: Low pay- but that's true in all adjunct roles Campus location isn't great

pros: A flexible work environment with a strong support structure.
cons: I really have no complaints about this job

pros: Work perks Friendly staff and faculty Pto
cons: Maternity leave plans Amount of overtime

pros: Student focused and supportive of faculty
cons: Sometimes classes are too small and too many preps

review_title: If you value your time, don't work here.
pros: Having a Chick-fil-a on campus was nice. Some of my coworkers were nice.
cons: Terrible work/life balance. Expected and demanded to work overtime while on salary, ending up making less per hour than I would at McDonalds.

pros: Work life balance is good
cons: Pay is very low for higher ed

job_title: Senior AV Technician in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Beautiful campus filled with a wonderful community.
cons: Not located near the nicest of neighborhoods

pros: Provides flexibility with your school schedule

pros: Great benefits that allow you peace of mind

job_title: Anonymous Employee in JAX Beach, FL
pros: good - not a bad place. pay more

job_title: Assistant Director of Residential Life in Jacksonville, FL
pros: flexible work place, great team work, amazing student leaders, on campus free housing. You also get a meal plan which is great. Beautiful campus to reside on.
cons: work life balance is tough, always too accessible, on call rotations can be very long nights. Heavily understaffed so the work load can seem overwhelming

job_title: Community Relations Coordinator in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Great coworkers/colleagues. Beautiful campus. Good weather
cons: Hi visibility position with low pay. Corporate atmosphere without the private sector compensation. Small town atmosphere. Lacks sophistication.

pros:
Free lunch once a week
Parking is free
Beautiful campus
cons:
I relocated for this position.  I was staff, not faculty.  The management has no direction and the entire job had very little to do with what I was hired to do. The faculty did not know my position existed unless they had to actually work with me.  It seemed that the management hired me just to clean up "messes" and put out fires.  Near the end, the job was that of a workhorse who sat in a very small office alone with no windows every day at a computer.  There was no team environment and it was as if the management and non-management worked in two different worlds.  We only knew what they chose to tell us.  I did not see my career going anywhere at JU. 
The health benefits are expensive and cover very little.
I worked in an old building where the climate control was never good.  Florida summers with faulty air conditioning is not conducive for a positive work environment.

pros: Tuition benefit for kids great
cons: Culture is very toxic and produces negativity

pros: Good teachers, small class sizes.
cons: So so expensive and the staff outside of teachers don't really care about you.

job_title: Associate Director of Creative Marketing in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Wonderful place to work at.
cons: Yearly pay is lower than average.

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Toronto, ON
pros: I worked in the afternoon after all my classes were done; which was nice
cons: None, at least not to me

job_title: Student Marketing Assistant in Jacksonville, FL
pros: I learned a lot about social media content creation, account management, and calendar planning, and it paid higher than almost any other on-campus job.
cons: Schedule was limited to the days my supervisor was in the office, so I had some long days and usually a couple hours a week on Saturdays.

pros: Flexible working environment, nice coworkers.
cons: No cons to speak of.

pros: Tuition benefits, Payed holidays and sick days, culture

pros: nice place to work at

pros: Good for experience for your career . Great people work there. Flexible hours. Family oriented

pros: The students are nice and respectful.

pros: Small teams so you get a lot of experience in your field, nearly a month of paid vacation and summer half-day Friday's.
cons: Not very diverse workplace, departments are siloed, donors have a lot of say as to what goes on.

review_title: Great place to be a student

pros:
Excellent benefits—great healthcare and time off

pros: Enjoy working there, great people
cons: None, none, none, none, none

review_title: Fun, got to do a lot of work and I was able to make my work flexible with my class schedule.
pros: Easy work, you make your own hours.
cons: Not quite as suitable for issues involving the pandemic.

pros: Benefits are great. The education benefit is amazing.  Spouse and children are eligible for free full time classes as long as they are accepted as students and full time employees may take up to 3 classes per semester.   JU is an incredible private university - very valuable.  Also paid time off  includes 2 weeks at Christmas, 3 days at Thanksgiving and full time administrative employees are eligible for 4 weeks vacation.  Please note: Tim Cost has been the president of JU for the last 4 years.  Kerry Romesburg retired.
cons: JU is a non-profit institution with free education so the pay for the same position in the corporate world would be much higher

job_title: Clinical Assistant Professor in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Teaching student is a wonderful experience.  Great Faculty to work with.
cons: The School of Nursing is held to a different standard than the rest of the University.  Faculty concerns go ignored by leadership.  Not every faculty member is treated the same.  Minimal to no communication with faculty and staff about changes that clearly affect them.  School of nursing leadership unwilling to address, acknowledge concerns and worse is they never want to take action.

pros: Great entry level starting place or retirement. Awesome work/life balance. Extremely generous vacation time and tuition assistance for family. Small employee base so everyone knows everyone. I enjoy being there and most of the other employess are excited about helping the college and students succeed.
cons: Compensation and cost of medical benefits. Because of the small staff, not as many promotional opportunities, but that is to be expected from small departments.

review_title: Great place to work as a student because they are flexible and see you as a student first and worker second.
pros: They are very flexible with your time and you have a lot of opportunities to make more money and hours depending on the job.
cons: They do not have a lot of diversity in certain higher regarded jobs and they are constantly paying you less than you deserve.

job_title: Spirit and Traditions Coordinator in Saint Johns, FL
pros: If you are a people person then this is the job for you. You have the ability to impact residents in a positive way and be engaged with the campus.
cons: There are no cons, like I said if you like people then this is the job for you. Be aware that the staff is diverse so there are many opinions and if can't handle that then it may not be the job for you.

review_title: Lousy pay and staff is 3rd class
pros: Close to home. Beautiful campus and location. Family atmosphere and fun interacting with the students. All events are free for the staff especially the athletics
cons: Staff are treated as an after thought.  Everyone is permitted to take classes but it is all contingent on your supervisors permissions. Many of the big departments (registrar and HR) are impossible to contact and employees are not crossed trained so if someone is out you have to wait until they return

review_title: Work in progress, but moving in the right direction!
pros:
- New, enthusiastic leadership  in President Tim Cost
- Updated and up and coming facilities
- Helpful resources for professors
- Small class sizes
- Increasing enrollment
- Small, beautiful campus
- Strong and growing athletic programs
cons:
- Communication across all levels needs improvement
- Somewhat siloed departments
- Resources and funding can be raised and improved
- Fend-for-yourself environment at times

pros: I do like JU, especially the division I teach in. Small classes. Good students. Beautiful campus. There are a lot of changes that overall feel like an upgrade. Great balance of work and personal life.
cons:
Pay is low. 
Enrollment numbers feel very down in my division.
There are a lot of changes going on right now (fairly new president and brand new provost), so that breeds bit of uncertainty about future.

job_title: International Admissions Officer in Jacksonville, FL
pros:
Although, they may look for someone with experience, you could be lucky and be accepted to the position as entry level.
Great tuition benefits (although you may be too busy to pursue a degree)
Your kids and spouse can go to school here for free and get their bachelors - Masters has some pay, however it is highly discounted.
cons:
Difficult to move up. 
Management can sometimes be poor.

job_title: Help Desk Technician in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Tons of Vacation time, and other wonderful benefits
cons:
The lack of professionalism (in the department) 
Upper management are old and stuck in their ways and the don't care for their employees. Simple.
Pay sucks 
If you're important enough you're allowed to make huge mistakes that affect the entire campus. If you're not, well you better be more accurate than Jesus Christ himself or you're out of a job.

pros: Wonderful people, great employee benefits, such as 20 PTO days, sick time that accrues ( up to 20 days off) and personal time, also has a great tuition benefits for employees.
cons: No room for growth because it is such a small school, even if you meet your numbers or exceed all expectations you don't get a raise, not even standard of living.

review_title: Good if you have no real ambition
pros: The benefits are nice with on campus meals, workout gym, with free weights, and relaxed atmosphere.
cons: If you are hired do not go in with the desire to be promoted up the hiring chain.
